trans-unit.source: Determines whether an assembly belongs to a code group by testing its software publisher's Authenticode X.509v3 certificate.
This class cannot be inherited.
A code assembly satisfies a publisher membership condition if that code is signed by the specified software publisher.
By default, code access security (CAS) does not check for <xref:System.Security.Policy.Publisher> evidence.

Unless your computer has a custom code group based on the <xref:System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition> class, you can improve performance by bypassing Authenticode signature verification.
This is accomplished by configuring the runtime to not provide <xref:System.Security.Policy.Publisher> evidence for CAS.
For more information about how to configure this option and which applications can use it, see the element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition"></xref> class with the Authenticode X.509v3 certificate that determines membership.
Code satisfies the membership condition if it is signed by the software publisher with the private key that corresponds to the specified public key certificate.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate"></xref> that contains the software publisher's public key.
The certificate parameter is `null`.
Gets or sets the Authenticode X.509v3 certificate for which the membership condition tests.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate"></xref> for which the membership condition tests.
The property value is `null`.
Determines whether the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition.
This membership condition tests only <xref:System.Security.Policy.Publisher> evidence.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Evidence"></xref> against which to make the test.
`true` if the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition; otherwise, `false`.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition.Certificate"></xref> property is `null`.
Creates an equivalent copy of the membership condition.
A new, identical copy of the current membership condition.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition.Certificate"></xref> property is `null`.

Determines whether the publisher certificate from the specified object is equivalent to the publisher certificate contained in the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition"></xref>.
If the two publisher certificates are equal, they represent the same <xref:System.Security.Policy.Publisher>.
The object to compare to the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition"></xref>.

`true` if the publisher certificate from the specified object is equivalent to the publisher certificate contained in the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition.Certificate"></xref> property is `null`.
Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The e parameter is `null`.
The e parameter is not a valid membership condition element.
Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel"></xref> context, used to resolve <xref href="System.Security.NamedPermissionSet"></xref> references.
The e parameter is `null`.
The e parameter is not a valid membership condition element.
Gets the hash code for the current membership condition.
The hash code for the current membership condition.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition.Certificate"></xref> property is `null`.
Creates and returns a string representation of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition"></xref>.
A representation of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition.Certificate"></xref> property is `null`.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition.Certificate"></xref> property is `null`.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state with the specified <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel"></xref> context, which is used to resolve <xref href="System.Security.NamedPermissionSet"></xref> references.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition.Certificate"></xref> property is `null`.
